fields.description:
https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/starter#licensingandordering-1 talks about Bamboo starter limitations 10 plans
But actually Bamboo allows to create not 10 plans, but 10 jobs. So you can have only 1 plan with 10 jobs and exceed your limit
fields.summary: Fix starter license limitations documentation

fields.description:
While this should not happen under normal circumstances, it seems to be common problem for people migrating from Bamboo Cloud who sometimes accidently re-run upgrade task.

Since it's entirely preventable in the code we are going to fix it for 5.15.
fields.summary: Prevent repository upgrade task from versions older than 5.14 to run if data is in already in 5.14 format.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to bulk delete users from the Bamboo internal user database. This can be time/resource exhaustive for instances with a lot of inactive users to be deleted.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement bulk methods for users, including modification, deactivation, and deletion.
 
h3. Workaround
Currently it is only possible to delete individual users
fields.summary: Bulk delete users from internal user database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a file that is read by Bamboo contains certain hidden characters, such as Form Feed ({{\f}}), Bamboo silently fails to read the file

h3. Suggested Solution
# Strip these hidden characters when the file being read
# Add more logging to include the failure reason

h3. Workaround
Add a script task before the task that reads the file, eg:
{code}
# removes the form-feed character
sed -i -e 's/\f//' <path-to-file>
{code}
fields.summary: Hidden characters in input files cause silent failures

fields.description: Currently, "View as YAML" is only available to Instance Administrator. Plan administrator does not have the permission.
fields.summary: Extend "View as YAML" ability to plan administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When "Enable Aliasing" is allowed for the application Bamboo in Crowd 2.10+ and a user has an alias, once synced to Bamboo -- the user has no groups.

The call to {{http://crowdurl/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/group/membership}} is *not* returning the aliased user name in Crowd 2.10+ when authenticated with the application credentials. This is causing problems mapping the groups back to the aliased users.

Other Bamboo calls such as {{http://crowd/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/search?entity-type=user&start-index=0&max-results=-1&expand=user}} return the aliased username.

h3. Environment
* Crowd 2.10+ (cannot reproduce on 2.9)
* Bamboo 5.14.3.1 (also affects other versions)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Bamboo with Crowd 2.10+ for user management
# *Crowd > Applications > Bamboo > Options > Enable Aliasing*
# Add a *bamboo-user* group within a directory associated to the Bamboo application
# Add a second group within a directory associated to the Bamboo application e.g. "test"
# Add a new user to the *bamboo-user* & *test* group.
# Under *User > Applications* set an alias for the application Bamboo
# *Bamboo Administration > Overview > User repository > Syncronize now*

h3. Expected Results
Under *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Users* the user with an alias should have two groups.

h3. Actual Results
Under *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Users* the user with an alias has no groups.
This severely impacts Bamboo permission schemes based upon groups.

h3.Workaround(s)
# Disable aliasing on the Crowd side and resync the user directory in Bamboo.
or
# Add the user directly to permissions for build / deployment plans, as opposed to group based permissions.
fields.summary: Bamboo user from Crowd has no groups when "Enable Aliasing" is on in Crowd 2.10+

fields.description:
We build a lot of software with Bamboo, designed to split the build work in several small steps.

 

I found that the build key text box, despite alone on the line, is very small and is not comfortable to use when you have a larger "speaking" job key.

 

E.g. I prefer a key named "BUILDPRJEXTJAVA8" (which stands for "build [project]'s java 8 extensions) instead of "JOB0015".

 

Is it possible to make the job key text box as large as the job name?
fields.summary: Make job key text box larger

fields.description:
As an admin I should know that when performing an upgrade the memory settings from the old instance needs to be migrated. It would save me time due to memory errors.
The following document need to be updated to include a memory configuration step:
[Bamboo upgrade guide \- Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-upgrade-guide-720411366.html]

(!) The same needs to be done for tomcat configuration
fields.summary: Add memory configuration step in Bamboo upgrade guide

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo does not work with LDAP systems using Posix Schema.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h4. 1. OpenLDAP
# Download and install OpenLDAP.
# Create a user LDIF:
{code:title=user.ldif}
dn: uid=bruno,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com
objectclass: inetOrgPerson
objectclass: person
givenName: Bruno
sn: Rosa
mail: test@test.com
uid: bruno
userPassword: bruno
cn: Bruno Rosa
{code}
# Import user LDIF:
{code}
ldapadd -v -h 192.168.90.100:389 -c -x -D cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com -W -f user.ldif
{code}
# Verify the user was added:
{code}
ldapsearch  -v -h 192.168.90.100:389 -b 'dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com' -D 'cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com'  -x -W '(&(objectClass=person)(uid=bruno))'
{code}
Response:
{noformat}
filter: (&(objectClass=person)(uid=bruno))
requesting: All userApplication attributes
# extended LDIF
#
# LDAPv3
# base <dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com> with scope subtree
# filter: (&(objectClass=person)(uid=bruno))
# requesting: ALL
#

# bruno, brosa.openldap.com
dn: uid=bruno,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
givenName: Bruno
sn: Rosa
mail: test@test.com
uid: bruno
userPassword:: YnJ1bm8=
cn: Bruno Rosa

# search result
search: 2
result: 0 Success

# numResponses: 2
# numEntries: 1
{noformat}
# Create Group LDIF:
{code:title=group.ldif}
dn: cn=developers,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixGroup
gidNumber: 678
{code}
# Import Group LDIF with:
{code}
ldapadd -v -h 192.168.90.100:389 -x -W -D cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com -f group.ldif
{code}
# To add the user to the group we need to create a new LDIF:
{code:title=add-user-group.ldif}
dn: cn=developers,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com
changetype: modify
add: memberuid
memberuid: bruno
{code}
# Add user to group with:
{code}
ldapmodify -v -h 192.168.90.100:389 -x -W -D cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com -f add-user-group.ldif
{code}
# Verify the user was added to the group:
{code}
ldapsearch  -v -h 192.168.90.100:389 -b 'dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com' -D 'cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com' -x -W '(&(objectClass=posixGroup))'
{code}
Response:
{noformat}
filter: (&(objectClass=posixGroup))
requesting: All userApplication attributes
# extended LDIF
#
# LDAPv3
# base <dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com> with scope subtree
# filter: (&(objectClass=posixGroup))
# requesting: ALL
#

# developers, brosa.openldap.com
dn: cn=developers,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixGroup
gidNumber: 678
cn: developers
memberUid: bruno

# search result
search: 2
result: 0 Success

# numResponses: 2
# numEntries: 1
{noformat}

h4. 2. Bamboo
# Create {{atlassian-user-custom.xml}} file with:
{noformat:title=atlassian-user.xml}
<atlassian-user>
    <repositories>
        <!-- LDAP repository -->
        <ldap key="ldapRepository" name="OpenLDAP" cache="true">
            <host>192.168.90.100</host>
            <port>389</port>

            <securityPrincipal>cn=admin,dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com</securityPrincipal>
            <securityCredential>admin</securityCredential>
            <securityProtocol>plain</securityProtocol>
            <securityAuthentication>simple</securityAuthentication>
            <baseContext>dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com</baseContext>

            <baseUserNamespace>dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com</baseUserNamespace>	
	    <userSearchFilter>(objectClass=inetOrgPerson)</userSearchFilter>
	    <usernameAttribute>uid</usernameAttribute>
            <firstnameAttribute>givenName</firstnameAttribute>
            <surnameAttribute>sn</surnameAttribute>
            <emailAttribute>mail</emailAttribute>
			
	    <baseGroupNamespace>dc=brosa,dc=openldap,dc=com</baseGroupNamespace>
            <groupSearchFilter>(objectClass=posixGroup)</groupSearchFilter>
	    <groupnameAttribute>cn</groupnameAttribute>
            <membershipAttribute>memberUid</membershipAttribute>
	    <useUnqualifiedUsernameForMembershipComparison>true</useUnqualifiedUsernameForMembershipComparison>
        </ldap>
        <!-- Default bamboo user repository -->
        <hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository" description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
    </repositories>
</atlassian-user>
{noformat}
# Configure Bamboo to use the *Custom user repository* from {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Security >> User repositories}}.

h3. Expected Results
Membership is set up so that users and groups are correctly populated.

h3. Actual Results
# {panel:title=Bamboo UI|borderStyle=solid|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
# User belongs to the 'developers' group from the Users page and most importantly, it is possible to access Bamboo with the user.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo Job Issues tab does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two JIRA issues
# Create two repositories in a Bamboo Build Plan
# Create two Jobs in the Bamboo Plan
# Create a commit with the first JIRA issue key in the first repository
# Create a commit with the second JIRA issue key in the second repository
# Set the first Bamboo Job to checkout the first repository
# Set the second Bamboo Job to checkout the second repository
# Build the plan

h3. Expected Results
The Build Plan will be linked with the two JIRA issues.
The first Bamboo Job Issue tab will show the first JIRA issue link.
The second Bamboo Job Issue tab will show the second JIRA issue link.

h3. Actual Results
The Build Plan will be linked with the two JIRA issues.
However, there are no JIRA issues link in both Jobs Issues tab
 
h3. Notes
* In another Build Plan, even if the JIRA issue is linked from the Job Issue tab (http://localhost:8085/browse/BAM-GIT-JOB1-22/issues), it will not be shown in the Build Issue tab (http://localhost:8085/browse/BAM-GIT-22/issues)
* Linking JIRA issue from Job Issues tab will not be shown in JIRA Issue Development Panel too
fields.summary: Bamboo Job Issues tab does not work

fields.description:
Hi,

We have two bamboo servers in our company, and currently a plan on one server cannot have child plan on another server (Plans cant talk to each other). Current workaround is to use bamboo apis. But having an ability to link Bamboo instances (similar to JIRA and Confluence) would be of great help..

Cheers. Please add comment if this needs explanation..
fields.summary: Ability to Link different instances of bamboo server - to share plans between them

fields.description:
h4. Problem 

When branches in the repository have "/" (slashes) or other special character Bamboo shows the name with "-" (hyphen) instead. This information being shown differently in the UI (in Bamboo branch names vs Bitbucket branch name) can lead some users to a confusion when creating regular expressions to use the automatic branch management in the plan. 

h4. Suggestion

Show the name in Bamboo UI as it is on repository
fields.summary: Bamboo should show branch names as they are in repository

fields.description:
Bamboo - Bitbucket integration issues might be a huge pain for customers. Authentication issues is hard to investigate and define the root cause.

Bamboo should contain more logs around authentication issue occurred when connect to remote Git repo (Bitbucket Cloud or Server) to help support team to find the root cause

 
{code}
2017-01-02 14:23:53,785 INFO [9-BAM::PlanExec:pool-17-thread-4] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Unable to detect changes : SANDBOX-PEAJ3 : com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandException: command /usr/bin/git ls-remote ssh://8b35a459-dd46-4f3e-9952-9962e3e08653@127.0.0.1:33851/bam/bamboo-version.git failed with code 128. Working directory was [.]., stderr:
Warning: Permanently added '[127.0.0.1]:33851' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
Permission denied (password).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}
fields.summary: Intermittent Permission denied (password) exception occurs for SSH proxy connections

fields.description:
Currently when we specify an EBS volume/snapshot to be mounted to a build image, this volume is created using the magnetic storage type.

This is a problem for builds that are disk IO intensive, or involve larger repositories, as it results in a significant amount of time added to build jobs.

While there are published workarounds to this (manual mounts in the instance startup scripts), they lack sufficient error handling to deal with an unsuccessful mount.

Ideally we really need to be able to specify the ebs volume type as part of the ebs volume/snapshot specification options, so that we can use *gp2* or *io1* where required.

 

This would involve a ui change to add the volume type dropdown, and amending the ec2-create-volume command in *restoreSnapshot.sh* to include *---type* 

 

Current volume type options are: 
 # standard
 # io1
 # gp2
 # sc1
 # st1
fields.summary: Add AWS Volume Type to Elastic Image Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Improvement
When Bamboo and Bitbucket are integrated and commits are received by Bamboo displayed on the build status page. Redirect to the relevant commit hash in Bitbucket like JIRA issue keys in commit messages.
fields.summary: Bitbucket commit redirect in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently with a parent -> child plan dependency, branch plans will only be triggered if the branch in the child matches the branch in the parent. In some cases users would like the ability to trigger all branches (or specific) of a dependent child plan (or even just another plan) at once, not just master or the matching branch plan.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Ability to select which branch plans to trigger in a dependent child plan.
* API option to force trigger entire plan (including branches) -- current options use change detection first.
fields.summary: Provide ability to trigger all (or specific) branches of a plan

fields.description: There have been a number of security issues in non-atlassian software caused by using the HOST header of an incoming request. Therefore, this suggestion issue to request that when Bamboo sees a request with a HOST header that does not match the instance's server url to redirect the request to the server url.
fields.summary: Redirect requests that have a different HOST header than what is configured to the correct (configured) server url.

fields.description:
Summary
When build result is removed I loose commit history and don't see all VCS changes. Changes tab should show all VCS difference between current build result and previous one. So if I had 3 build results with 1 commit in each of them I want to see 2 commits on build result #3 if I removed #2
fields.summary: When a build result is removed I want to see all VCS changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After importing an export zip from an older version of Bamboo (e.g. 5.9.7) into Bamboo 5.14 using a Microsoft SQL Server database and restarting -- Bamboo fails to start with {{java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name 'id'.}}

Note this does *not* occur if the import is performed as a step from the setup wizard instead of importing into an already running instance via *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Import*

h3. Environment
* Microsoft SQL Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an export of a Bamboo instance from an older version of Bamboo e.g. 5.9.7
# Install a new Bamboo 5.14.3.1 instance pointed to a Microsoft SQL Server database with the recommended collation _Latin1_General_CS_AS_.
# *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Import* and import the export zip from Bamboo 5.9.7.
# Restart Bamboo once import finishes.

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo starts-up successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2017-01-03 11:00:04,912 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -----------------------------------------------------------
2017-01-03 11:00:04,912 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51110 : Disallow duplicate trusted keys - remove duplicates
2017-01-03 11:00:04,912 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -----------------------------------------------------------
2017-01-03 11:00:04,921 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name 'id'.
java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name 'id'.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:372)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2988)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2421)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:671)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.processResults(JtdsStatement.java:613)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQL(JtdsStatement.java:572)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeImpl(JtdsStatement.java:809)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeUpdate(JtdsStatement.java:1288)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeUpdate(JtdsStatement.java:1241)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyStatement.executeUpdate(NewProxyStatement.java:410)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v5_11.UpgradeTask51110DisallowDuplicateTrustedKeys.lambda$doUpgrade$1(UpgradeTask51110DisallowDuplicateTrustedKeys.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.AbstractBootstrapUpgradeTask.withDatabaseConnection(AbstractBootstrapUpgradeTask.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v5_11.UpgradeTask51110DisallowDuplicateTrustedKeys.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask51110DisallowDuplicateTrustedKeys.java:42)

# Import the export zip during the installation wizard rather than into a running instance of Bamboo 
or

fields.description:
There's a feature gap between Jenkins and Bamboo in terms of historical reporting of performance numbers from JUnit. I try to illustrate this in a few screenshots.

The tests are nicely grouped by packages:

  !jenkins-1.png|width=580,height=305!

 

Drilling in, we see each test case with the detailed performance number from this test:

 

!image-2016-12-29-17-07-43-682.png|width=580,height=305!

until I reach a single test:

!jenkins-3.png|width=580,height=305!

 Now to the key element: Clicking on the right upper timing value, we can even see a diagram over time: 

  !jenkins-4.png|width=580,height=305!

 

All that is not available through the test result parser in Bamboo.

Are there alternative ways to collect and display this data that I'm not aware of? Thanks for your kind support.
fields.summary: Performance number history from junit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there is multi directory test files, the wild card "*" asterisk does not work well in Mocha Test Runner

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{last_commit_date}} stored against a branch in {{branch_commit_info}} is set from the *AuthorDate* instead of the *CommitDate* of a git commit when JGit (no native git) is used. When native git is used, the {{last_commit_date}} is correctly set to the CommitDate.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a commit to a branch so that the latest commit has a different commit date and author date. E.g. {{git cherry-pick}}
# Ensure that no native git capability is defined so that JGit is utilized
# Create a plan in Bamboo using that repository
# Create the branch manually that you committed to

h3. Expected Results
{{last_commit_date}} stored against a branch in {{branch_commit_info}} is set from the CommitDate

h3. Actual Results
{{last_commit_date}} stored against a branch in {{branch_commit_info}} is set from the AuthorDate
This can result in branches being detected for deletion earlier than expected.

h3.Workaround
Install native git on the Bamboo Server and define a capability for it at *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Server Capabilities*

The {{last_commit_date}} on an affected branch won't be updated using the CommitDate until a new commit is made.
fields.summary: Last commit date of a branch is taken from the Author Date of the commit when using JGit in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Build Plan Subversion manual branch detection path will affect all the Build Plans that are using the same Subversion

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Subversion repository http://localhost:8080/subversion/reponame in Bamboo
# Create two Build Plans to use the same Subversion repository
# Edit the first Build Plan A to detect branches using Branch detection path "releases/planA"
# Click on the button "Create plan branch" in Build Plan A
It will show the list of branches like "releases/planA/branchA1", "releases/planA/branchA2", etc
# Click "Cancel" to close the pop up window
# Open the second Build Plan B in a new browser tab
# Edit the second Build Plan B to detect branches using Branch detection path "releases/planB"
# Click on the button "Create plan branch" in Build Plan B
It will show the list of branches like "releases/planB/branchB1", "releases/planB/branchB2", etc
# Click on the button "Create plan branch" in Build Plan A again

h3. Expected Results
Build Plan A will show the list of branches like "releases/planA/branchA1", "releases/planA/branchA2", etc again

h3. Actual Results
It is showing the list of branches like "releases/planB/branchB1", "releases/planB/branchB2", etc
 
h3. Notes
* If both pop up windows are closed and "Create plan branch" is clicked again in Build Plan A after a few minute, it will show the correct list but Build Plan B will then show the incorrect results
* Subversion branch path cache is used in all the build plans causing "releases/planA/branchA1" and "releases/planB/branchB1" created in both Build Plans if Automatic branch management is enabled
fields.summary: Subversion manual branch detection path is used in all the plans

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During an upgrade to 5.13 or greater, upgrade task *51301 : Change column names to uppercase on Microsoft SQL* fails with {{51301 : Change column names to uppercase on MS SQL}}. This occurs when the *Containment Type* of the database is Partial or Full (e.g. in Azure). Due to the system catalog being a case-insensitive collation, *sp_rename* to change the column casing thinks there is a duplicate and fails.
h3. Environment
 * Microsoft SQL 2012+ with a Containment type on the database of Partial or Full (Azure)
 * Upgrade to Bamboo 5.13 or above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Upgrade a Bamboo Microsoft SQL database with Partial containment type from a version older than 5.13 to a version >=5.13.

h3. Expected Results

Upgrade succeeds.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{code:java}
2016-12-19 12:01:58,310 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] --------------------------------------------------
2016-12-19 12:01:58,310 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51301 : Change column names to uppercase on MS SQL
2016-12-19 12:01:58,310 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] --------------------------------------------------
2016-12-19 12:01:58,341 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] java.sql.SQLException: Error: The new name 'ENTITY_NAME' is already in use as a COLUMN name and would cause a duplicate that is not permitted.
java.sql.SQLException: Error: The new name 'ENTITY_NAME' is already in use as a COLUMN name and would cause a duplicate that is not permitted.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:372)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2988)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2421)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:671)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.processResults(JtdsStatement.java:613)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQL(JtdsStatement.java:572)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeImpl(JtdsStatement.java:809)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.execute(JtdsStatement.java:1282)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyStatement.execute(NewProxyStatement.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.db.MsSqlDbmsBean.renameColumn(MsSqlDbmsBean.java:200)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v5_13.UpgradeTask51301UpperCaseDbColumnNames.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask51301UpperCaseDbColumnNames.java:59)
{code}
h3. Workaround

None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo allows users to override linked repository settings on branches, but not master.

If a company has one large repository linked centrally, and they only need to check out certain portions, it would help to be able to override the "include files" option in each Plan.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement repository settings override on master (trunk) plan.
 
h3. Workaround
There are two possible workarounds at time of writing:
# (For Bamboo 5.14+) Create a branch for each Plan, and override the repository settings on the branch
#* Optionally use Bamboo's Branch merging to merge changes back to Master 
# Created one Linked repository for each plan, and use the "Include files" option to only include certain subdirectories
fields.summary: Override linked repository settings on master branch

||AMIs||
|ami-1|
|ami-2|
|ami-3|

Would be interesting having a setting to limit how many AMIs can run simultaneously.
||AMIs||Limit||
|ami-1|2|
|ami-2|5|
|ami-3|1|

So if there are 3 builds in queue (PROJ-A-1, PROJ-B-1, PROJ-C-1) and they all have requirements from {{ami-1}}, Bamboo should not start up a new ami-1 since its limit was defined as 2. Consequently, {{PROJ-C-1}} should wait for the any of the other two plans to finish so the {{ami-1}} would become available.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Not possible to add connection timeout to SMTP mail configuration in the Administration

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new connection timeout setting for SMTP mail configuration in the Administration 

h3. Why this is important
* There is no need to restart Bamboo (when using the workaround) if mail configuration need to be changed
* No need to add JNDI in the new {{server.xml}} file when upgrading Bamboo
 
h3. Workaround 
h5. For Bamboo versions prior to 6
# Shutdown Bamboo
# Copy the file {{<bamboo-install>\atlassian-bamboo\WEB-INF\lib\javax.mail-*.jar}} into {{<bamboo-install>\lib}}
# Delete {{<bamboo-install>\atlassian-bamboo\WEB-INF\lib\javax.mail-*.jar}}
# Edit the file {{<bamboo-install>\conf\server.xml}} to add the following SMTP settings (Resource tag only):
{noformat}
                <Context path="" docBase="${catalina.home}/atlassian-bamboo" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
                	
                	<Resource name="mail/SmtpServer"
            			auth="Container"
            			type="javax.mail.Session"
            			mail.smtp.host="smpt.host.name"
            			mail.smtp.port="25"
            			mail.smtp.auth="true"
            			mail.smtp.user="username"
            			password="password"
            			mail.transport.protocol="smtp"
            			mail.smtp.connectiontimeout="20000"
          			/>

                    <!--<Resource name="UserTransaction" auth="Container" type="javax.transaction.UserTransaction"-->
                              <!--factory="org.objectweb.jotm.UserTransactionFactory" jotm.timeout="60"/>-->
                    <Manager pathname=""/>
                </Context>
{noformat}
# Start Bamboo
# Edit the mail setting at {{Administration >> Communication >> Mail server}}
# Select the option “JNDI” in “Email settings”
# Fill in the value “java:comp/env/mail/SmtpServer” in “JNDI location”
# Save the settings

h5. For Bamboo 6 onwards:
The workaround process is the same, but for steps 2 and 3, 2 libraries must be moved instead of one:
- javax.mail-api-x.x.x.jar
- javax.mail-X.X.X.jar
fields.summary: Ability to add connection timeout to SMTP server in the Administration
Add new feature to Jboss

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot save any changes to auto-incremented variables at *configureDeploymentProjectVersioning.action* (*Edit Deployment Project > Release Versioning* without admin or restricted admin access. After checking or unchecking a variable for auto-increment and hitting save, no error is presented and you're returned to the deployment project. Upon re-entering the Release Versioning UI you can see the changes haven't been committed.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a build plan with a plan variable E.g. variable = version, value = 1
# Grant full permissions to the build plan to a non-admin user
# Create a deployment project using that build plan as a source
# Grant full deployment project permissions to a non-admin user
# Login as non-admin user
# Edit deployment project > Release versioning
# Add variable to version > variable you created before
# Check the checkbox to select variable you created before for auto-increment
# Save

h3. Expected Results
* Changes are saved

h3. Actual Results
* When returning to the *Release versioning* UI, changes haven't been saved and no error was presented when saving.
 
h3. Notes
* If you revoke Edit permissions from a user for the Build plan, you successfully get an error message that says:
{quote}
Your updates result in changes to whether a plan variable is automatically incremented or not. You do not have permission to make changes to the plans variables.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Only current workaround is to grant Restricted Admin access
fields.summary: Cannot select a variable for version auto-increment without admin access in Bamboo

<successfulTestCount>317</successfulTestCount>
<failedTestCount>0</failedTestCount>
<quarantinedTestCount>18</quarantinedTestCount>
<skippedTestCount>48</skippedTestCount>
{noformat}

Notice that the *buildTestSummary* says 383 passed. In reality only 317 passed for sure. 18 may or may not have passed, and 48 tests were not run.

Needless to say, we need to do our own reporting to get an accurate reporting of results and totally ignore the *buildTestSummary* field as being meaningless.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a build result is removed, the table "plan_vcs_history" still holds the information about the last revision checked out for that build. As consequence the next build will show only commits/issue links included after that revision, not after the revision of the last build which Bamboo shows results from.
This leads to a confuse behavior, since the user didn't see the commits between the last build on summary results and the latest.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Bamboo linked to a JIRA instance
# Run a build
# Commit some code with JIRA keys on it 
# Remove the build result
# Run a new build
# Note that no commit nor issue linked will be shown between this result and the last one

h3. Expected Results
The new build will show all commits and issues linked between the last result in Bamboo and the latest revision

h3. Actual Results
No commit or linked issue which was associated to the deleted results is shown

h3. Workaround:
# Backup your Bamboo data
# Run the following delete statement
{code:sql}delete from PLAN_VCS_HISTORY where plan_key='<PLAN-KEY>' and build_number=<BUILD-NUMBER>;{code}
# Repeat the last step for every build deleted
# Run a new build
fields.summary: When a build result is removed, the details on table "plan_vcs_history" should also be removed

h3. Summary

Using the wizard referenced in the doc below, the instance that comes up automatically has an incorrect base URL defined:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Running+Bamboo+Server+in+AWS


h3. Environment
* Windows


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run the wizard.

The base URL of the new instance is, for example, similar to this:
{quote}https://ec2-54-183-195-105.us-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com{quote}

The base URL of the new instance is, for example, similar to this:
{quote}https://asd=ec2-54-183-195-105.us-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com{quote}

# Update the base URL.

h3. Summary
Bamboo EC2 wizard fails to contact WWW server when instance doesn't have a public DNS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Run Bamboo EC2 wizard and select a VPC which doesn't automatically assign a public DNS / IP.

Waiting until WWW server becomes available............................................................
Unable to contact your WWW server. Try to connect to it via SSH to check what went wrong.

h3. Notes
* Even though it has NullPointerException, somehow the upgrade tasks have "Completed successfully" message.
* The upgrade should have failed

h3. Cloud Migration specific
This can also occur if you're attempting to run upgrade tasks on an already upgrade Bamboo database. For example if you're running through the Bamboo Cloud EOL migration, you might have successfully started Bamboo at some point on your database. Then you might have replaced *bamboo.cfg.xml* with the one from the *cloud-export.zip*, which contains version information that is now out of sync with the current database version. The next time you start Bamboo it will attempt to upgrade the database from 5.12 to 5.14, which already had completed. The fix for this is: 
# Shutdown Bamboo
# Restore your *cloud-export.zip/database/dbDmp.dmp* again (you will lose any previous modifications, but it's the only way to ensure the integrity of the data)
# Replace *<bamboo-home>/bamboo.cfg.xml* with the one from *cloud-export.zip/bamboo-home* (re-modify any database settings to point to your database server / db)
# Now your bamboo version is in sync between filesystem and database
# Start Bamboo
fields.summary: Error extracting branch name during upgrade tasks

fields.description:
*Problem definition*

When a plan branch is created, the build number for that branch starts at zero. This leads to very confusing situations when the build (or even a release) is not always triggered from the same branch. Functional workarounds exist, but since Bamboo doesn't reflect them in the dashboard, this causes confusion.

 

*Suggested solution*

Have a configurable plan option: "_Ensure unique build number accross plan branches_". This should make the buildNumber variable exist only once in the plan (and not for each plan branch). Every build within the plan (regardless from which plan branch) will then have a unique build number.
The minor downside of this approach could be that the build numbers for a particular branch are not sequential (however always ordered) and may contain 'gaps'.

 

*Workaround*

Currently, a possible workaround is to use a custom Plan variable as the build number. Use the "Version Variable Incrementer"-task from the [Variable version tasks|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.variable.updater.variable-updater-generic/server/overview] addon to increment that variable on each build. Though this works for having unique build numbers, it's causes confusion because the actual build numbers don't match those shown in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Is should be possible to have unique build numbers accross plan branches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When multiple repository is configured in a source checkout task, the checkout is not done in series order.

## 2nd repository check out to subdir1
## 3rd repository check out to subdir2

# Run the plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user password contain pounds symbol (£), Bamboo SSH task will fail to connect

h3. Environment
* Windows Server 2016
* Cygwin OpenSSH

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Cygwin OpenSSH in a Windows machine

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo shows the timestamp of build results and release based on server timezone. However, when viewing the deployment results,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure your computer is in a different timezone than the server
# Deploy a release to the environment
# Go to the environment details page in {{viewEnvironment.action}}. Observe the _Completed_ timestamp
# Click on _Result_ page that leads to {{viewDeploymentResult.action}}
# Observe the timestamp

h3. Expected Results
The timestamp should be consistent throughout the environment details and results page
h3. Actual Results
The environment details displays the timezone of the server.
The results page displays the timezone of the browser/user.
fields.summary: Deployment result screen shows time based on user timezone instead of server time

fields.description:
I can't be the only person running smoke tests after deploying to environments.  

I need to be able to see test results in the deployment results page, whether that comes from the JUnit Parser or any other similar test results parser that is able to run during a Build Plan.
fields.summary: Display Test Results after Deployment

fields.description:
Sometimes I need to create a clone of existing linked repository and change only branch name. It might be too complex due of additional settings (regexp etc). 

I would like to have an ability to clone repository and change only the branch and name. 

My use case is: I create plans for each stable JIRA version and I have projects with plan clones for each stable branch, so that I don't have to use branch view with plans that are on this repo but does not contribute to the health of that branch. I can use projects, I can have a bookmark that takes me to the overview of my branch (like: [https://server-gdn-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/J72SPT|https://server-gdn-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/J72SPT).]).

Every time I cut another stable branch I need to clone my branches.
fields.summary: Clone linked repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Bamboo EC2 wizard sets up an apache reverse proxy in front of Bamboo that handles SSL and forwards internally to the tomcat listener on 8085. However, it doesn't setup the tomcat proxy attributes in {{/media/atlassian-data/installs/bamboo/atlassian-bamboo-5.xx.x/conf/server.xml}}:
{code}
proxyName="ec2-xx-xxx-xxx-xxx.yyyyyyyyyy.compute.amazonaws.com"
proxyPort="443"
scheme="https"
secure="true"
{code} 
* {{proxyName}} should be set to the Public DNS.

Full connector example:
{code}
<Connector
            protocol="HTTP/1.1"
            port="8085"

            maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
            connectionTimeout="20000"
            disableUploadTimeout="true"
            acceptCount="100"

            enableLookups="false"
            maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"

            useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
            URIEncoding="UTF-8"

            redirectPort="8443"
            proxyName="ec2-xx-xxx-xxx-xxx.yyyyyyyyyy.compute.amazonaws.com"
            proxyPort="443"
            scheme="https"
            secure="true"
            />
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
While this might be slightly redundant as users will more than likely have to change this at some point once they setup their DN, it would be great if the wizard set these attributes up initially so we don't hit XSRF errors out of the box.
fields.summary: Improve Bamboo EC2 Wizard to initially setup proxy settings in server.xml

fields.description:
I'm sure many, like me, use the Artifacts feature of Build Plans to save HTML test reports.  This enables us to view the specific report from a particular build run, or have a permanent link to the very latest.

However, I don't only run tests during build, but also post deployment (e.g. "smoke tests").  I would like to be able to create Deployment Artifacts in exactly the same way, so that I can access a link to the reports created.
fields.summary: Create artifacts during Deployment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a Bamboo Cloud export to a Bamboo Server database, the Cloud export tries to create the table with owner like bamboo_123456. If this user is not set up in the new PostgreSQL database with access to the tables, Bamboo will not function correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow upgrade steps in Migration Hub

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo is imported and the data is visible in the app
h3. Actual Results
Import completes with errors, and the data is not reachable by Bamboo, causing Bamboo to start a new instance.
The below exception is thrown in the import log file:
{noformat}
ERROR:  role "bamboo_123456" does not exist
ERROR:  role "bamboo_ro_737006_1" does not exist
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
# Run the following command on the dbDump.dmp file before the import:
{code}
bambooUser=$(grep "OWNER TO bamboo_" dbDump.dmp | head -1 | sed -re 's/.*(bamboo_[[:digit:]]*).*/\1/') ; sed s/${bambooUser}/bamboo/g dbDump.dmp | grep -v bamboo_ro >dbDumpConverted.dmp
{code}
# Import dbDumpConverted.dmp instead of dbDump.dmp:
eg {{psql -U bamboo -d bamboo < ~/bamboo/database/dbDumpConverted.dmp}}

(!) If you have already started Bamboo on your previous database dump you will also need to restore your *bamboo-home* directory from the *cloud-export/bamboo-home* version to ensure critical upgrade tasks are performed on the new dump you just restored when Bamboo is next started.
fields.summary: Cloud export contains table owner like bamboo_[numbers] making Bamboo tables inaccessible after import

Actual Results The grey screen remains, with the following tag remaining active and showing in the Developer Tools panel: {code:xml}
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After restoring backup from older version into the latest version during the Installation wizard, there are missing Active Object table that should exist in the latest version
h3. Environment
 * MySQL
 * PostgreSQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a backup with the Export function in Bamboo 5.8.1
 # Shutdown Bamboo 5.8.1
 # Install Bamboo 5.14.1
 # Start Bamboo 5.14.1
 # Fill in the license in the Installation Wizard
 # Configure it to use MySQL/PostgreSQL server
 # In the next Installation wizard, import data from the backup in Step 1

h3. Expected Results

After restore, the latest Active Object will be automatically created
h3. Actual Results

After successfully restore the backup, the following Active Objects are missing:
 * AO_88263F_HEALTH_CHECK_STATUS
 * AO_88263F_PROPERTIES
 * AO_88263F_READ_NOTIFICATIONS
 * AO_C7F71E_OAUTH_SVC_PROV_TKNS
 * AO_F1B80E_BRANCH_SELECTION

h3. Notes
 * Application Link does not work correctly due to "AO_C7F71E_OAUTH_SVC_PROV_TKNS" table missing
 * Only AO tables that does not exist in the backup file are missing
* Users installing Sonar4Bamboo and attempting to configure it after encountering this issue may encounter the below error until Bamboo is restarted:
{code}
Request information:
Request URL: http://localhost:8085/admin/sonar4bamboo/createSonarServerConfig.action
Scheme: http
Server: localhost
Port: 8085
URI: /admin/sonar4bamboo/createSonarServerConfig.action
Context path:
Servlet path: /admin/sonar4bamboo/createSonarServerConfig.action
Path info:
Query string:
Stack Trace:

java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: Task java.util.concurrent.FutureTask@4ecad816 rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@6e5bf6ee[Terminated, pool size = 0, active threads = 0, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = 6]
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$AbortPolicy.rejectedExecution(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.reject(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.execute(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService.submit(Unknown Source)
at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateExecutorService.submit(ThreadLocalDelegateExecutorService.java:64)
at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1.apply(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:86)
at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1.apply(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:79)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Restart Bamboo. The missing tables will be detected and Bamboo will create them anew.
fields.summary: Active Object tables missing if restore backup from older version

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While installing or upgrading Bamboo, the following ERROR message is observed in the logs:
{code:java}
2016-12-01 13:22:45,047 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [SchemaUpdate] HHH000388: Unsuccessful: alter table VCS_LOCATION add constraint FK_6lo84xenkp53fi9ke6mje2350 foreign key (PARENT_ID) references VCS_LOCATION
2016-12-01 13:22:45,047 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [SchemaUpdate] Column 'VCS_LOCATION.VCS_LOCATION_ID' is not the same data type as referencing column 'VCS_LOCATION.PARENT_ID' in foreign key 'FK_6lo84xenkp53fi9ke6mje2350'.
{code}
This means Hibernate failed to define relationships between the tables because the columns use different data type in Microsoft SQL Server, and since Hibernate does not enforce constraints, as it's only a mapping tool to map java objects to the database, it fails to add the constraint and outputs the error message above.
h3. Environment
 * Bamboo connected to Microsoft SQL Server 2012+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Bamboo 5.12.
 # Connect it to a Microsoft SQL Server database.
 # Upgrade Bamboo to v5.14 
 # Start Bamboo.
 ** During the upgrade process Hibernate will try to map and create the relationship between tables.

h3. Expected Results

Hibernate should create the relationship between tables as it does when using other database servers (e.g. PostgreSQL).
h3. Actual Results

Hibernate fails to create the relationship between tables whose columns use different data types.
h3. Reason

Bamboo 5.13 uses MSSQL2012 Dialect which maps long fields to bigint, previous dialect mapped longs to number(19, 0).

In Bamboo 5.14 new column PARENT_ID was added to VCS_LOCATION table with reference constraint to VCS_LOCATION.VCS_LOCATION_ID. PARENT_ID is bigint, VCS_LOCATION remained number(19, 0)
fields.summary: Unsuccessful alter table as columns use different data type in Microsoft SQL Server 2012+

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Build fails to start because of an XSRF error:
{noformat}
XSRF: A mutative operation was attempted on PlanBuildNumbersImpl within a non-mutative HTTP request
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a build from the UI when the page has some JS errors, not showing CSS

h3. Expected Results
Build starts.

h3. Actual Results
Build fails due to XSRF exception.
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not generate next build number for 'CW-DEV'
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.BuildNumberGeneratorServiceImpl.generateBuildNumber(BuildNumberGeneratorServiceImpl.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.trigger.ManualBuildDetectionAction.generateResultWithoutChanges(ManualBuildDetectionAction.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl$3.createBuildDetectionResult(ChainExecutionManagerImpl.java:509)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl.createNewChainState(ChainExecutionManagerImpl.java:565)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl.createChainStateNoDetection(ChainExecutionManagerImpl.java:504)
...
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: XSRF: A mutative operation was attempted on PlanBuildNumbersImpl within a non-mutative HTTP request: https://bamboo.blogistics.be/build/admin/triggerManualBuild.action?buildKey=<build-key> [[BUILD_ID, <build-number>]]->
->[[BUILD_ID, <next-build-number>]]
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.XsrfUtils.fail(XsrfUtils.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.hibernate.ReadOnlyGetMethodEnforcer.fail(ReadOnlyGetMethodEnforcer.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.hibernate.ReadOnlyGetMethodEnforcer.onFlushDirty(ReadOnlyGetMethodEnforcer.java:62)
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Disable XSRF protection by performing the following:
# Click the cog icon in the Bamboo header and choose *Overview*.
# Choose *Security settings* in the left-hand panel.
# Choose *Edit*.
# Uncheck _Enable XSRF protection_ to *disable* XSRF protection
# Choose *Save*.
fields.summary: XSRF: A mutative operation was attempted on PlanBuildNumbersImpl within a non-mutative HTTP request

h3. Summary
When the remote agent process is terminated by the wrapper on Windows, child processes will remain running. This is different to the behavior on a *nix based OS.

h3. Environment
* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Build a simple script task on a Windows remote agent that does this:
{code}
ping 127.0.0.1 -n 60
echo test > newfile.txt
{code}
# Kill the agent process after it starts building (5 secs later)

h3. Expected Results
* Consistent behavior between OS 

h3. Actual Results
# newfile.txt is still generated after 60 seconds, ping.exe still running after agent has restarted

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Terminating the remote agent process on Windows does not terminate child processes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo does not display all users coming from LDAP if amount of users exceeds {{MaxPageSize}} defined in Active Directory.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.14.1
* Windows Active Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a new OU, adding 1501 users:
{code:java}dn: CN=bamboo.user0000,OU=users,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local
cn: bamboo.user0000
memberOf: CN=bamboo-win-ad,OU=groups,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local
sAMAccountName: bamboo.user0000
{code}
{code:java}dn: CN=bamboo.user1500,OU=users,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local
cn: bamboo.user1500
memberOf: CN=bamboo-win-ad,OU=groups,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local
sAMAccountName: bamboo.user1500
{code}
# connect Bamboo to the Windows AD:
{code:xml|title=<bamboo-home>/xml-data/configuration/atlassian-user.xml, atlassian-user-custom.xml}<atlassian-user>
    <repositories>
        <!-- LDAP repository -->
        <ldap key="ldapRepository" name="myLdapRepository" cache="true">
			<host>thanos.atlassian.local</host>
			<port>636</port>

			<securityPrincipal>CN=admin.user,CN=Users,DC=atlassian,DC=local</securityPrincipal>
			<securityCredential>admin.password</securityCredential>
			<securityProtocol>ssl</securityProtocol>
			<securityAuthentication>simple</securityAuthentication>
			<baseContext>DC=atlassian,DC=local</baseContext>

			<baseUserNamespace>OU=users,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local</baseUserNamespace>
			<userSearchAllDepths>true</userSearchAllDepths>
			<userSearchFilter>(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*))</userSearchFilter>
			<usernameAttribute>sAMAccountName</usernameAttribute>
			<firstnameAttribute>givenName</firstnameAttribute>
			<surnameAttribute>sn</surnameAttribute>
			<emailAttribute>mail</emailAttribute>

			<baseGroupNamespace>OU=groups,OU=ps8102,DC=atlassian,DC=local</baseGroupNamespace>
			<groupSearchAllDepths>true</groupSearchAllDepths>
			<groupSearchFilter>(objectClass=group)</groupSearchFilter>
			<groupnameAttribute>cn</groupnameAttribute>
			<membershipAttribute>member</membershipAttribute>
        </ldap>
        <!-- Default bamboo user repository -->
        <hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository" description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
    </repositories>
</atlassian-user>
{code}
# search for users by hitting [http://localhost:8085/admin/user/viewUsers.action?usernameTerm=&fullnameTerm=&emailTerm=&startIndex=990] in the web browser.
(i) As a result, Bamboo lists the users up until 1000.

h3. Expected Results
* Bamboo should paginate results over {{MaxPageSize}}

h3. Actual Results
* Bamboo displays only the amount records set up in {{MaxPageSize}}

h3. Notes
||Property||Default||Description||
|MaxPageSize|1000|This value controls the maximum number of objects that are returned in a single search result, independent of how large each returned object is. To perform a search where the result might exceed this number of objects, the client must specify the paged search control. This is to group the returned results in groups that are no larger than the MaxPageSize value. To summarize, MaxPageSize controls the number of objects that are returned in a single search result.|
_Extracted from_ [https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/315071]

h3. Workaround
# Increase _MaxPageSize_ in Active Directory
** review and update the {{MaxPageSize}} in Windows AD. Followed this documentation ([https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/315071])
 !MaxPageSize.png|thumbnail!
** reconnect Bamboo with LDAP by selecting {{Custom user repository}} under {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> User repositories}}
** search for users by hitting [http://localhost:8085/admin/user/viewUsers.action?usernameTerm=&fullnameTerm=&emailTerm=&startIndex=1190|http://localhost:8085/admin/user/viewUsers.action?usernameTerm=&fullnameTerm=&emailTerm=&startIndex=1490] in the web browser.
(i) As a result, Bamboo listed the users up until ~1200.
# Connect LDAP to Crowd/JIRA and connect this with Bamboo instead
fields.summary: Bamboo does not paginate records over MaxPageSize

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, to view group membership in Bamboo, we need to query the database instead of viewing this in Bamboo as we can with other products. This applies to instances using internal user management.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a page under Admin >> Groups  to view group membership.

h3. Workaround
The following SQL query can pull group membership from the Bamboo database:
{code:sql}
SELECT name, email, fullname 
FROM users u 
JOIN local_members l 
    ON u.id = l.userid 
JOIN groups g 
    ON l.groupid = g.id 
WHERE g.groupname = '<group-name>';
-- replace <group-name> above with the group you are querying
{code}
fields.summary: View Group Membership in UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo is no longer able to handle artifacts whose filenames have an umlaut (¨). It fails to publish artifacts in this case. *This is a regression of BAM-17614*.

h3. Environment
We can replicate it in Bamboo {{5.12.0-D20160518T090318}} but we cannot replicate in {{5.10-OD-15-001}} (haven't tested in other versions), which shows this has changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a build plan in Bamboo with a single task: a script task
# Add the following code to the task: {{echo Test > testumlaut_ü.test}}
#* Notice that the last ‘u’ has an umlaut
# Create an artifact definition that includes the generated file (tested with shared artifacts)
#* A simply copy pattern like ‘*’ is enough
# Run the plan

h3. Expected Results
The build is successfully run and the ‘testumlaut_ü.test’ is added as an artifact in the build result.

h3. Actual Results
Though the build is successful, it doesn’t contain any artifacts.
The build log shows this:
{noformat}
error	24-May-2016 15:04:55	Unable to publish artifact [Test]: 
simple	24-May-2016 15:04:55	The artifact hasn't been successfully published after 13.33 s
{noformat}

The Bamboo Server logs show this:
{noformat}
2016-05-26 22:29:57.397037500 2016-05-26 22:29:57,396 INFO [http-nio-6990-exec-4] [ArtifactServlet] Receiving Artifact [Test] for TEST-TEST-JOB1-2
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400482500 2016-05-26 22:29:57,399 ERROR [http-nio-6990-exec-4] [ArtifactServlet] Exception when storing the artifact
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 java.nio.file.InvalidPathException: Malformed input or input contains unmappable characters: testumlaut_ü.test
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.encode(UnixPath.java:147)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.<init>(UnixPath.java:71)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400484500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystem.getPath(UnixFileSystem.java:281)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400484500 	at sun.nio.fs.AbstractPath.resolve(AbstractPath.java:53)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400489500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooFiles.resolvePathUnderParent(BambooFiles.java:170)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400489500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.messages.ArtifactStreams.deserialiseStreamToDir(ArtifactStreams.java:79)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400490500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.messaging.ArtifactServlet.storeArtifact(ArtifactServlet.java:114)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400490500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.messaging.ArtifactServlet.doPost(ArtifactServlet.java:100)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:648)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:291)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400495500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400496500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:39)
{noformat}

The agent logs show this:
{noformat}
2016-05-24 15:19:22,865 ERROR [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [BambooArtifactHttpTransport] Unexpected HTTP status code: HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
2016-05-24 15:19:22,865 INFO [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [AbstractArtifactManager] Handler com.atlassian.bamboo.build.artifact.BambooRemoteArtifactHandler did not publish the artifact
2016-05-24 15:19:22,866 WARN [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [AbstractArtifactManager] Unable to publish artifact [test]:
{noformat}


h3. Notes
This is the only invalid character found so far, but there may be others.

h3.Workaround
Change tasks to generate file names without the ‘umlaut’.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Bitbucket returns a 404 or 401 when trying to query for tags and branches, Bamboo logs the whole HTML response in the logs. This can cause the logs to grow in size.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Bitbucket Cloud linked repository and create a plan to use it
# Delete the bitbucket repository in Bitbucket Cloud
# Go to {{Edit Plan >> Branches}}

h3. Expected outcome
Bamboo logs the whole HTML response:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed}
2016-11-29 11:02:50,180 WARN [http-nio-8085-exec-20] [RESTCall] Response from GET /1.0/repositories/username/reponame/branches-tags/ null (404): <!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta id="bb-bootstrap" data-current-user="{"username": "dericleeyy", "displayName": "Deric Lee", "uuid": "{ecf95ecb-e91a-40e6-b6f6-b658aca3b60f}", "firstName": "Deric Lee", "avatarUrl": "https://bitbucket.org/account/dericleeyy/avatar/32/?ts=1480407352", "lastName": "", "isTeam": false, "isSshEnabled": true, "isKbdShortcutsEnabled": true, "id": 2946122, "isAuthenticated": true}" />
  
  
...
{noformat}

h3. Improvement
Improve the exception handling for these cases and avoid filling the logs

h3. Workaround
Mute _some_ of the RESTCall logs by adding this in {{Bamboo Install/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed}
log4j.category.com.atlassian.utils.RESTCall=ERROR
{noformat}

Then, restart Bamboo
fields.summary: Better exception handling when getting 401 or 404 from Bitbucket Cloud rest call

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With current branch detection patterns in Bamboo when you have a SVN repository setup like the following, automatic branch detection is not effective.

Example:
Trunk: 
* http://domain.tld/svn/software/trunk/01_CODE

Branches:
* http://domain.tld/svn/software/branches/some_branch1/01_CODE
* http://domain.tld/svn/software/branches/some_branch2/01_CODE
* http://domain.tld/svn/software/branches/some_branch3/01_CODE

With current functionality, you would need to configure Bamboo to detect branches at http://domain.tld/svn/software/branches/ to successfully detect each branch. However this means you need to pull down the entire repository contents of http://domain.tld/svn/software/branches/some_branch1/ instead of just the sub-project 01_CODE for each branch.

h3. Suggested Solution
Functionality to apply the sub-project path to each detected branch for checkout.
fields.summary: Automatic branch detection pattern for SVN repositories with sub-projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo doesn't substitute plans variables in "Repository URL" for auto-detected plan branches. It happens when using a linked SVN repository path like the one below and branching at "L2".
{code:java}http://svnserver/svn/repo/${bamboo.L1}/${bamboo.L2}/trunk{code}
 
h3. Environment

Bamboo 5.10.3 build 51020
 Operating System: Linux
 SVN version 1.8.10 (r1615264)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a SVN repo with the following URL: [http://hostname/svn/repo/clevel/ulevel/trunk/]
 - Create a Bamboo linked SVN repository pointing to:
{code:java}http://hostname/svn/repo/${bamboo.L1}/${bamboo.L2}/trunk/{code}

 - Create a test plan to use the above linked repository
 - Create a test plan to use the above linked repository
 - Define the Plan variables {{L1 = clevel}} and {{L2 = ulevel}}
 - Turn on automatic plan management (Create plan branches for all new branches).
 - Create a branch in SVN at [http://hostname/svn/repo/clevel/ulevel/branches/autoBranch1/]

Manual branch creation through the Bamboo UI works fine, the problem is only on the automatically created plans branches.
 Variable substitution on plan branches works if defining Global variables instead of Plans variables.
h3. Expected Results
 # Bamboo newly created plan branch, will show the correct URL under "Source Repository" substituting variables "L1" and "L2" and.

h3. Actual Results
 # Bamboo newly created plan branch, shows the incorrect URL (unsubstituted variables) under Source Repository and will not build.
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't substitute plans variables in "Repository URL" for auto-detected plan branches in SVN repos.

If a Visual studio solution has spaces on it the user need to put the solution name between double quotes.
There no clue for that in the UI and if it is not used the build with fail with the following errors:
{code}
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	Microsoft (R) Build Engine Version 2.0.50727.7905
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	[Microsoft .NET Framework, Version 2.0.50727.8000]
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 2005. All rights reserved.
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	MSBUILD : error MSB1008: Only one project can be specified.
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	Switch: Application3.sln
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	
22-Nov-2016 10:44:51	For switch syntax, type "MSBuild /help"
{code}

This is the result when using double quotes {{"Console Application3.sln"}}:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Bamboo user I want to retrieve repository information from the Bamboo REST API
h3. Suggested Solutions
 # Add a /repositories endpoint that would list repositories used by Build plans.
 # Add repository data to /plan endpoint

h3. Workaround

This could be retrieved from the Bamboo database:
{code:title=mysql}select b.full_key, vl.name, substring(vl.plugin_key, locate(':', vl.plugin_key)+1) type, vl.xml_definition_data 
from build b 
join plan_vcs_location pvl on (b.build_id = pvl.plan_id) 
join vcs_location vl using (vcs_location_id);
{code}
{code:title=postgres}select b.full_key, vl.name, substring(vl.plugin_key from position(':' in vl.plugin_key)+1), vl.xml_definition_data 
from build b 
join plan_vcs_location pvl on (b.build_id = pvl.plan_id) 
join vcs_location vl using (vcs_location_id);
{code}
fields.summary: Retrieve repository information from REST API

h3. Summary

Bamboo is unable to connect to an unsupported database following the instructions on the ["How do I connect Bamboo to an unsupported database"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/How+do+I+connect+Bamboo+to+an+unsupported+database] documentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Install Bamboo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+installation+guide].
 # Put the appropriate JDBC driver jar file into your application server's classpath by copying the jar file into the *webapp/WEB-INF/lib* directory.
 # [Set the following system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+system+properties] before starting your upgraded Bamboo server to enable "Unsupported Database" as a selectable option in the Setup Wizard:
{noformat}
-Dbamboo.enable.unsupported.db=true
{noformat}
 # Start Bamboo.

h3. Expected Results
 - At Step 2 of the [Bamboo Setup Wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Running+the+Setup+Wizard], choose *External Database > Unsupported Database*.

h3. Actual Results
 - At Step 2 of the [Bamboo Setup Wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Running+the+Setup+Wizard], there is no *External Database > Unsupported Database* option available. The only options available are from the databases we support (see [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Supported+platforms] for details).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Removing agent dedications can currently only be done one at a time. 
h3. Suggested Solution
h4. Remove All

Add a remove all feature, similar to the Repository cache "Delete all"
h4. Multi-delete

Add the ability to multi-select and remove dedication, eg: with a checkbox
h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround except to do this manually.
fields.summary: Bulk Remove Agent Dedication

fields.description:
Create plan
Create repo in plan
Forgot to enter repo name
Click Save button

Expected: validation error
Actual: validation error. Twice. See screenshot
fields.summary: Duplicate validation error when create plan repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
h4. Scrolling

Whenever a linked repository is saved in {{Administration >> Linked Repositories}}, the list returns to the top. On an instance with a large number of linked repositories, this complicates editing the repositories.

Additionally, the Save button only exists at the bottom of the page, making scrolling mandatory.
h4. Bulk editing

Often, we want to make the same modifications to multiple Linked repositories. As it is now, we have to do that edit once per Linked repository.
h3. Suggested Solution
h4. Scrolling

Have the page update in-place, not needing to reload. For example, have the objects save via AJAX call.

Also, have the Save button floating instead of static at the bottom of the page.
h4. Bulk editing

Implement a bulk edit feature.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for either at this time.
fields.summary: Improvements on Admin >> Linked Repositories page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently when Application Links are deleted and readded *after moving or restoring Bamboo and/or the target app to new servers*, we need to resave all of the configurations using that AppLink, such as Linked Repositories.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(Tested against Bitbucket Server v4.8.5 and v4.11.1)
 # Create an AppLink from Bamboo to Bitbucket Server
 # Create and save a Linked Repository
 # Use that repository in a Build Plan
 # Run a build from that plan
 # Export Bamboo backup
 # Load the Bamboo backup onto a new server
 # Delete and readd the AppLink
 # Run the Build

h3. Expected Results

The Linked Repository will pick up the existing SSH key(s) and work
h3. Actual Results
 * The below exception is thrown in the job log, and on the job overview page:
{noformat}Errors getting changes for [BUILD ID]:
This error may have occurred due to an authentication issue with Bitbucket Server. Save the repository configuration to refresh the authentication details.
{noformat}

 * We need to save the linked repository to add a new SSH Key to Bitbucket Server.

h3. Workaround

(!) This workaround is not efficient for users with a lot of Linked Repositories.
 # Go to the linked Repository
 # Click "Login & Approve"
 # Save the repository
fields.summary: Can testing servers seamlessly change, or use the same, SSH keys?

fields.description:
I have a Plan with 6 Jobs.  
If any of the jobs fail, then I have to wait for the other jobs to complete before I can re-run the failed jobs.
This means I have to sit and wait for the longest job to complete, just so I can click the 'rerun failed jobs' button.

It would be nice if I could restart any failed jobs as soon as they fail.
fields.summary: Allow failed jobs to be restarted without waiting for every job to finish.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Ubuntu stock image in the Sydney AWS region does not have node6 installed. The capability isn't present and when listing the location it should be there is no file there. Node6 is installed on the US East Ubuntu Stock image.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check the capabilities of the Ubuntu stock image with the Asia/Pacific (Sydney) region selected.

h3. Expected Results

Node6 is present.

h3. Actual Results

Node6 is not present
 
h3. Notes

AMI is ami-65163506

h3.Workaround

Copy the image from the US East region to the Sydney region.
fields.summary: Ubuntu Stock Image in Sydney region does not have node6

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now, we don't have a way to notify only the person who runs/triggers a build. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a "Runner" option which will notify the user who has triggered the build.
 
h3. Workaround
If you have a setup where builds or branches are always run by the same person, you can use a "User" or "Email" type notification and specify their username or email address.
fields.summary: Add "Runner" Notification Recipient type

fields.description:
Deployment plans just seem like a quick add on to Bamboo. For example, there is no ability to "favorite" a deployment so that I can filter to just the ones I care about on the main deployment screen.

It would also be nice to create dashboards like the build screen.
fields.summary: Add build dashboard features to deployment page

fields.description:
We would like to be able to tie a deployment configuration to a set of branches. When doing full GitFlow, Bamboo will pick up new feature/, release/, etc. branches and build them, but the build variables will not be correctly set for those branches.

For example, I want all my feature/* branches to use a specific set of variables so that they build for the dev environment. As is, when i create a feature/test-feature branch, I need to go in and configure it to override specific variables. If another dev goes in and creates feature/another-test feature, they need to go in and configure the same variables which is just duplication of work.

It would be nice if we could have a set of variables configurable for a wildcard like feature/* and then be able to go into the specific feature/feature-name branch and override if necessary. As is there are global variables and branch variables. I am proposing another layer: global, wildcard, then branch variables. Of course the wildcard variables should be optional as per the current branch variables.

This would then require a similar feature in the deployment plans where feature/* branches would use the environment(s) configured for that set of branches.
fields.summary: Ability to create wildcard variables plan branches
