fields.description:
Our issue with Bamboo deployment projects is that it does not function like the build projects.

Bamboo build projects link to a default repository branch and then pick up new branches to build.
This becomes an issue for us in the deployment projects that we want to have specific branches deployed ONLY to their matching environments.

For example, I want my develop branch to only be tied to the Dev environment because our dev branch has variables set in the build to configure the application specifically for that environment. Our develop branch should NEVER be deployed to test or production. The same goes for our feature/* (only be deployed to Dev), release/* (only be deployed to Test) branches, and master only deployed to Production. When configured as described, a new deployment from develop should only show the option of Dev environment when creating a deployment.

This requires the ability to assign environments per branch - in our case we would only configure one environment tied to a branch. This eliminates the possibility of creating a release for deployment to an environment that should not have that code. This will become important for us in that we are moving to a model where separation of duties is important. We want it to be very clear where certain code will be deployed when someone else is pushing the deploy button.
fields.summary: Ability assign environments per branch

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unused repository configuration is not getting removed from the database as part of the *removeUnusedRepositories* job.
h3. Environment
 * Bamboo connected to PostgreSQL database.
 * Bamboo connected to Oracle database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Repositories are cleaned up on two different events, both trigger the *removeUnusedRepositories* job:
 # When a build plan is deleted.
 # When Expiry is run (Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Plans >> Expiry).

{panel:title=Bamboo 5.10.3|borderStyle=solid|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
There are two cases cases where {{MARKED_FOR_DELETION}} is set to TRUE but the repository definition is *not* deleted - when it still has a reference in any of the following tables:
 # VCS_LOCATION_ID column (from REPOSITORY_CHANGESET table)
 # VCS_LOCATION_ID column (from DEPLOYMENT_VERSION_CHANGESET table)
{panel}

{panel:title=Bamboo 5.14.1|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6386AE|titleBGColor=#99C0ED|bgColor=#D6E6F7}
There are three cases cases where {{MARKED_FOR_DELETION}} is set to TRUE but the repository definition is *not* deleted - when it still has a reference in any of the following tables:
 # VCS_LOCATION_ID column (from REPOSITORY_CHANGESET table)
 # VCS_LOCATION_ID column (from DEPLOYMENT_VERSION_CHANGESET table)
 # PARENT_ID column (from VCS_LOCATION table)
{panel}

h3. Expected Results

If the repository definition is marked for deletion and does not contain a reference to it in any of the tables/columns mentioned above, it should be removed as part of the *removeUnusedRepositories* job.
h3. Actual Results

The *removeUnusedRepositories* job is indeed executed every time a plan is deleted or the Expiry process is run:
{panel:title=Bamboo 5.10.3|borderStyle=solid|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
{code:java}delete 
  from VCS_LOCATION 
 where MARKED_FOR_DELETION=?
   and  not (exists (select repository1_.REPOSITORY_CHANGESET_ID 
                       from REPOSITORY_CHANGESET repository1_ 
                      where repository1_.VCS_LOCATION_ID=VCS_LOCATION_ID)) 
   and  not (exists (select mutabledep2_.DEP_VERSION_CHANGESET_ID 
                       from DEPLOYMENT_VERSION_CHANGESET mutabledep2_ 
                      where mutabledep2_.VCS_LOCATION_ID=VCS_LOCATION_ID))
{code}
{panel}

{panel:title=Bamboo 5.14.1|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6386AE|titleBGColor=#99C0ED|bgColor=#D6E6F7}
{code:java}delete 
  from VCS_LOCATION 
 where MARKED_FOR_DELETION=?
   and  not (exists (select repository1_.REPOSITORY_CHANGESET_ID 
                       from REPOSITORY_CHANGESET repository1_ 
                      where repository1_.VCS_LOCATION_ID=VCS_LOCATION_ID)) 
   and  not (exists (select mutabledep2_.DEP_VERSION_CHANGESET_ID 
                       from DEPLOYMENT_VERSION_CHANGESET mutabledep2_ 
                      where mutabledep2_.VCS_LOCATION_ID=VCS_LOCATION_ID)) 
   and  not (exists (select repository3_.VCS_LOCATION_ID 
                       from VCS_LOCATION repository3_ 
                      where repository3_.PARENT_ID=VCS_LOCATION_ID))
{code}
{panel}
(i) If you turn any of the DELETE queries above into SELECT queries they always return empty, despite the repository configuration does not contain any references anymore.

The repository definition is not removed from the database.
fields.summary: Unused repositories are not getting pruned from the database
Editing new repository plugin data through deprecated interface doesn't work
NPE when trying to edit repository if plugin is not installed

fields.description: Currently, you can configure child dependencies on the parent build plan. Unfortunately, this seems backwards for a microservice componentized architecture. Every parent shouldn't have to know about it's potentially hundred children. Every new project added should just be able to configure it's projects that it is dependent on so when one of them changes, the child plan is built.
fields.summary: Build child plans when parent dependencies are built

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to access the artifact if it is created with multiple directories and have the folder name "resources" 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file "test.txt" in the directory "resources/testfolder"
# Create a artifact name "test" with copy pattern "resources/**"
# Create a file "test2.txt" in the directory "testfolder2"
# Create a artifact name "resources" with copy pattern "testfolder2/*"
# Commit the above files into a Git repository
# Run the Bamboo plan
# Try to access the above artifacts

h3. Expected Results
Able to access the aritifacts successfully

h3. Actual Results
Fail to access with the artifact with the page error:
{noformat}
Page not found

Sorry, the page you were trying to reach does not exist. Try going back to the dashboard and browse the site to find the page you were looking for.

Go to...

Site homepage
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* No error in the logs
* It seems that the problem will happen if there is "resources" in the URL
* Can access the files in the "resources" directory but not the files in the sub-directory of "resources", for example: /resources/<can_access>/*can't_access*
fields.summary: Unable to access artifact if the URL have the word "resources"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an administrator, I would like a way to grant a permission that would allow a user (or group) to deploy all projects / environments sourcing a build plan.

h3. Suggested Solution

A permission on the build plan permissions tab that would allow a user (or group) to execute deployment on any deployment project that uses this build plan as the source. Ideally we could restrict this to only add certain environments if required rather than the entire project.
fields.summary: Permission that would allow user (or group) to deploy all projects sourcing a build plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When dedicating an agent to a deployment plan, if no agent is selected before clicking *Add* a Null Pointer Exception is thrown instead of a user-friendly error message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a deployment plan, go to *Agent assignment*
 # Under *Dedicate agents and images*, click *Add* without selecting an agent

h3. Expected Results

A human readable error like _"You must specify an agent or image"_ should be displayed, similar to the behaviour that occurs when clicking Add on the Required capability section on the same page
h3. Actual Results

A Null Pointer Exception is thrown
!nullpointerexception.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Trying to add dedicated agent to deployment plan, with no agent selected, throws NPE instead of showing user-friendly error
